analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu rnams kyi rjes su yi rang zhing gnyen por gnas pa'o //

original: rig sngags kyi gsang sngags kyis gso ba'i sman dang / gsang sngags kyi tshig ni gang zhe na /

original: 'dir ni dug gi rang bzhin gyis zas ma legs pa 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni dug gi rang bzhin gyis zas ma legs pa 'byung ba ste /

analyzed: zas ma legs pa ni rnam par rtog pa las 'byung ba'o //

original: rnam par rtog pa ni dug lnga'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni dug lnga'o //

original: dug lnga ni gti mug yin te /
analyzed: dug lnga ni gti mug yin te /

analyzed: gti mug gi rang bzhin gyis zhe sdang byung ngo //

analyzed: zhe sdang las 'dod chags byung ngo // 'dod chags las nga rgyal byung ngo //

original: nga rgyal las phrag dog byung ngo //
analyzed: nga rgyal las phrag dog byung ngo //

original: de lnga 'dus pas 'jig rten gyi dug gsum la 'dus te /
analyzed: de lnga 'dus pas 'jig rten gyi dug gsum la 'dus te /
translated: The combination of those five is the three poisons of the world.

analyzed: 'jig rten gyi dug gsum ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang gsum mo //

original: de'i rang bzhin gyis 'khor ba'i rgyu ste /üîΩ'khor ba la phyi'i dug gsum byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyis 'khor ba'i rgyu ste / 'khor ba la phyi'i dug gsum byung ngo //

original: phyi'i dug gsum ni 'jig rten pa'i las las byung ba'o //
analyzed: phyi'i dug gsum ni 'jig rten pa'i las las byung ba'o //

original: de yang 'gro ba dang bsdad pa dang byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang 'gro ba dang bsdad pa dang byed pa'o //

analyzed: 'gro ba'i dug ni bsam pa dang / mthong ba dang reg pa dang kha rlangs so //

analyzed: bsam pa la yang gnyis te /

analyzed: reg pas bsam pa dang / mthong nas bsam pa'o //

analyzed: reg pa la yang gnyis te /

analyzed: nga rgyal gyis reg tu 'gro ba dang / rang bzhin gyis dbang du med par reg tu 'jug pa'o //

translated: Likewise, the brahmin's brahmin, the king's king, the merchant's merchant, and the servant's servant is the outcaste.üîΩThe times are morning, noon, one-third, and evening.

analyzed: srod dang nam byed dang / sum cha gcig dang tho rangs so //

analyzed: skyug par 'dod cing dang @126a * //

original: ga mi bde'o //
analyzed: ga mi bde'o //

analyzed: rgyal po'i dus ni nyi ma phyed yin te /

analyzed: mkhris pa'i dus so //

analyzed: nad chu ser gyi dus so //

original: dmangs rigs kyi dus ni dgongs mo ste /
analyzed: dmangs rigs kyi dus ni dgongs mo ste /

analyzed: mgo mjid  rengs shing na ba ste /

analyzed: rkan 'khal zhing skad 'gags te rna ba 'on zhing mig dmar /

analyzed: kha dog skya ba /

analyzed: mig 'gul zhing lus po thams cad 'gul ba'o //

analyzed: rus pa dang rkang las byung ba ni /

analyzed: yang dmangs rigs kyi nad yin te /

analyzed: lus po skam zhing dang ga 'gags pa ste /

analyzed: sme ba 'byung zhing g-yan pa'i nad kyis thebs pa'o //

analyzed: mche ba'i dug kyang klu'i rigs shes te /

analyzed: sems can las shes par bya'o //

analyzed: yang bsdad pa'i dug la rtsa ba dang lo ma las byung ba'o //

analyzed: de la lo ma'i dug ni de rnams kyi lo ma'o //

analyzed: de zos pa'i nad ni shi ba dang / grang ba dang / smyo ba dang / brgyal ba dang / nar nus pas so //

analyzed: de ni bsdad pa'i dug gi nus pa'o //

analyzed: de'i nad kyis snying mi dga' ste /

original: snying la byung ba'o //
analyzed: snying la byung ba'o //

original: bod phrug gi sha dang 'ug pa'i sha shing kun dang ngo //
analyzed: bod phrug gi sha dang 'ug pa'i sha shing kun dang ngo //
translated: The flesh of a Tibetan child and the flesh of an owl are the same.

original: de yan lag la babs te /
analyzed: de yan lag la babs te /
translated: If it descends to the limbs,

original: grang shum byed cing tsha ba skye ste /
analyzed: grang shum byed cing tsha ba skye ste /

original: rta'i mchin pa dang / chu bya'i sha dang / thar nu rnams so //
analyzed: rta'i mchin pa dang / chu bya'i sha dang / thar nu rnams so //
translated: The liver of a horse, the flesh of a water bird, and garlic.

original: de lus la babs te rus pa 'gags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lus la babs te rus pa 'gags par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it descends to the body, it causes the bones to ache.

original: yang na zas @126b mi legs pa yang sbyor pa'i dug yin te /
analyzed: yang na zas @126b mi legs pa yang sbyor pa'i dug yin te /
translated: Also, improper food is a poison that combines with the other poisons.

original: sbrang rtsi dang mar gnyis mnyam por byas nas 'khar phor gyi nang du zhag bdun bzhag ste /
analyzed: sbrang rtsi dang mar gnyis mnyam por byas nas 'khar phor gyi nang du zhag bdun bzhag ste /

original: de yang byed pa'i dug go //
analyzed: de yang byed pa'i dug go //

original: mkhris pa la tsha ba btang na de yang dug yin te /
analyzed: mkhris pa la tsha ba btang na de yang dug yin te /

original: rlung la grang ba gtang ba yang dug go //
analyzed: rlung la grang ba gtang ba yang dug go //

analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dug 'di ni rang bzhin rang las 'byung ste /

original: ma rig pa'i rang bzhin gyis rang la rang gnod pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rang bzhin gyis rang la rang gnod pa'o //

original: slob dpon las kyi rdo rjes tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa /
analyzed: slob dpon las kyi rdo rjes tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa /
translated: Master Karmavajra spoke in verse:

original: gti mug dang ni 'dod chags dang // zhe sdang rang bzhin rang dug ste //üîΩ'jig rten pa yi dug gsum 'di //
analyzed: gti mug dang ni 'dod chags dang // zhe sdang rang bzhin rang dug ste // 'jig rten pa yi dug gsum 'di //
translated: Delusion, desire, and anger are the three poisons of the mind.üîΩThese three worldly poisons

original: phyi yi dug kyang de las byung //
analyzed: phyi yi dug kyang de las byung //
translated: give rise to the three outer poisons.

original: 'gro dang bsdad dang sbyor ba dang // sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun gyis //
analyzed: 'gro dang bsdad dang sbyor ba dang // sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun gyis //

original: phyi yi dug ni 'joms par nus //
analyzed: phyi yi dug ni 'joms par nus //

original: rig sngags gzi brjid de 'joms nus //
analyzed: rig sngags gzi brjid de 'joms nus //
translated: The splendor of the vidyƒÅ-mantra is able to destroy them.üîΩDelusion, desire, and anger

original: gti mug 'dod chags zhe sdang dang // rang gi sems kyis bcom pa la //
analyzed: gti mug 'dod chags zhe sdang dang // rang gi sems kyis bcom pa la //
translated: are conquered by one‚Äôs own mind.

original: gzhan gyis de ni mi choms so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis de ni mi choms so //

original: bdag gis de ni bor bar bgyi //
analyzed: bdag gis de ni bor bar bgyi //

original: de skad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de skad ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus it was said.

original: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo dug gi gnyen po 'di /
analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo dug gi gnyen po 'di /
translated: This queen of vidyƒÅ mantras, the great peacock queen, is the antidote to poison.

original: dug gsum gso ba la yang dag par nus pa'o //
analyzed: dug gsum gso ba la yang dag par nus pa'o //
translated: It is truly effective in curing the three poisons.

original: gsang sngags dang sman dang ting nge 'dzin gyi bye brag gis gso bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags dang sman dang ting nge 'dzin gyi bye brag gis gso bar bya ba'o //
translated: It is to be cured through the specific vidyƒÅ-mantra, medicine, and samƒÅdhi.

original: 'gro ba'i dug gso ba ni /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i dug gso ba ni /
translated: The cure for the poisons of beingsüîΩis as follows:

original: nad pa la rig sngags kyi rgyal mo'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs la /
analyzed: nad pa la rig sngags kyi rgyal mo'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs la /
translated: For the sick, one should enter into the meditative absorption of the queen of awareness mantras.

original: rig sngags kyi gsang sngags la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi gsang sngags la 'jug pa'o //

original: ltor btang ba'i sman ni /
analyzed: ltor btang ba'i sman ni /

analyzed: mu zi dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / ram nye ba'i rtsa ba'i khu ba dang / de rnams ltor btod ba'o //
translated: realgar, the three fruits, and the juice of ramnya root‚Äîthese should be taken internally.

original: grang ba chen tsha ba gsum dang / tsha dang bsres pa sbrang rtsis sbyar la btang ngo //
analyzed: grang ba chen tsha ba gsum dang / tsha dang bsres pa sbrang rtsis sbyar la btang ngo //
translated: For great cold, take the three hot medicines mixed with salt and honey.

analyzed: chu ser babs na thal ka rdo rje dang / ba ku la dang / se 'brum gyi phyi skogs dang bsres la btang ngo //
translated: If there is a discharge of lymph, take realgar, bakula, and the outer skin of sesame seeds mixed together.

original: rig sngags kyi gsang sngags zhag bdun bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi gsang sngags zhag bdun bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: One should accomplish the secret mantra of awareness for seven days.

original: phol mig dang lus po gas par gyur na mu zi dang mar nag bskol la dug dang 'bras bu gsum dang bsres la ser ka rnams la byug go //
analyzed: phol mig dang lus po gas par gyur na mu zi dang mar nag bskol la dug dang 'bras bu gsum dang bsres la ser ka rnams la byug go //
translated: If there are blisters and the body is cracked, boil realgar and black aconite, mix with poison and the three fruits, and apply to the cracks.

original: byab par 'dod na dang po phyag gis bgyi ste /
analyzed: byab par 'dod na dang po phyag gis bgyi ste /
translated: If one wishes to perform an exorcism, first do it with the hand.

original: gnyis ba rtsva d'ur bas bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis ba rtsva d'ur bas bya'o //
translated: Second, do it with durva grass.

original: gsum pa rtsva ku shas te /
analyzed: gsum pa rtsva ku shas te /
translated: Third, with kusha grass.

original: bzhi pa rma bya'i sgro'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa rma bya'i sgro'o //
translated: Fourth, with a peacock's feather.

original: lnga pa rang gi sos dug dbyung ngo //üîΩrig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma @127a * //üîΩbya chen mo'i nga rgyal gyis byas la /
analyzed: lnga pa rang gi sos dug dbyung ngo // rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma @127a * // bya chen mo'i nga rgyal gyis byas la /

original: shu ba dang / g-ya' ba dang / mdze dang / phol mig dang / g-yan pa dang / me dbal dang / lhog pa dang / 'bras dang / sha bkra dang / dmu chu dang / 'brum bu dang / sha ro la sogs pa'i mdze'i rigs thams cad la de bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: shu ba dang / g-ya' ba dang / mdze dang / phol mig dang / g-yan pa dang / me dbal dang / lhog pa dang / 'bras dang / sha bkra dang / dmu chu dang / 'brum bu dang / sha ro la sogs pa'i mdze'i rigs thams cad la de bzhin du bya'o //
translated: One should do the same with all types of leprosy, such as boils, eczema, leprosy, blisters, scabies, herpes, erysipelas, smallpox, measles, tumors, and so on.

original: byug pa dang / bdug pa 'dod na /
analyzed: byug pa dang / bdug pa 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes for ointments and fumigations,

analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i nag po'i sbyor ba la bya'o //
translated: one should do them with the previously explained black procedure.

original: ting nge 'dzin mnyam par bzlas pa drag po la 'jug go //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mnyam par bzlas pa drag po la 'jug go //
translated: One should engage in intense recitation with meditative concentration.

original: de bzhin du 'gro ba'i dug gso ba'i bya thabs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gro ba'i dug gso ba'i bya thabs so //
translated: Thus, it is the method of curing the poison of going.

original: bsdad pa'i dug gso ba ni /
analyzed: bsdad pa'i dug gso ba ni /

analyzed: sngo ma h'a ra tsa dang / chu grang mo la sbyar nas /
translated: One should mix neem leaves with cold water,

original: sngags lan bdun nam /
analyzed: sngags lan bdun nam /

original: nyi shu rtsa gcig gam /
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gcig gam /

original: brgya rtsa brgyad btab la 'thung du gzhug go //
analyzed: brgya rtsa brgyad btab la 'thung du gzhug go //
translated: One should have the patient drink it after reciting the mantra one hundred and eight times.

original: 'di ni btsan dug dang bong nga nag po'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni btsan dug dang bong nga nag po'i gnyen po'o //
translated: This is the remedy for aconite and black aconite.

original: ra dug la 'bras bu gsum dang lcags phye btab la /üîΩbu chung 'o ma 'thung ba'i chu 'am /
analyzed: ra dug la 'bras bu gsum dang lcags phye btab la / bu chung 'o ma 'thung ba'i chu 'am /
translated: For radugu, one should add the three fruits and iron filings,üîΩand have the patient drink it with the water that a young girl who drinks milk uses for washing,

original: rang gi chu la btab la 'thung du gzhug go //
analyzed: rang gi chu la btab la 'thung du gzhug go //
translated: or with one‚Äôs own urine.

original: des ni btsan dug kyang thub po //
analyzed: des ni btsan dug kyang thub po //

analyzed: sribs shing gi 'bru gu la 'bras bu gsum gyis bya'o //
translated: For the sprouts of the poisonous tree, one should use the three fruits.

original: smyo bar gyur na skyur mo'i chu rtsa'am khu ba blud do //
analyzed: smyo bar gyur na skyur mo'i chu rtsa'am khu ba blud do //
translated: If one has gone mad, one should drink sour water or the juice of the root.

original: de ni thang phrom gyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de ni thang phrom gyi gnyen po'o //

original: gas par gyur na mar nag dang / gu gul dkar po dang sbyar la byug go //
analyzed: gas par gyur na mar nag dang / gu gul dkar po dang sbyar la byug go //
translated: If one has become paralyzed, one should apply a mixture of black mustard oil and white gugul.

analyzed: skrangs par gyur na thang phrom gyi rtsa ba dang / ri sho ba'i rtsa ba dang / dug rang dang sbyar la mnan no //
translated: If one has become swollen, one should apply a compress of thorn-apple root, rishoa root, and poison.

original: / gzhan yang thams cad chu grang la btab la btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: / gzhan yang thams cad chu grang la btab la btung bar bya'o //

original: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo'i rig sngags kyi gsang sngags bton la bya'o //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo'i rig sngags kyi gsang sngags bton la bya'o //

original: de ni bsdad pa'i dug gso ba'i bcos thabs so //
analyzed: de ni bsdad pa'i dug gso ba'i bcos thabs so //

original: da ni byed pa'i dug gso ba ste /
analyzed: da ni byed pa'i dug gso ba ste /

analyzed: byed pa'i dug ni sbyor ba'i dug go // yungs kar ma tshig par brdos la /

original: brdung ba byas la lto stong la gtang ngo //
analyzed: brdung ba byas la lto stong la gtang ngo //

original: de bzhin du zhag gsum bzhi btang bar gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhag gsum bzhi btang bar gyur na /

original: lo gcig bar du thub pa'o //
analyzed: lo gcig bar du thub pa'o //

analyzed: sha tshan gsum dang skyer ba dang / se rgod pa'i bar shun dang / aa rur dang / ra dmar mo'i khrag dang ri lu byas la btang ngo //

analyzed: 'dis ni lo gsum gyi bar du thub ste /

original: lo gcig the tshom mi za bar thub bo //
analyzed: lo gcig the tshom mi za bar thub bo //

original: sha dug byung na sga chung @127b dang tshal chu grang mo la btab la btung ngo //
analyzed: sha dug byung na sga chung @127b dang tshal chu grang mo la btab la btung ngo //

analyzed: rin po che'i dug byung na lcags phye dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / ldum bu re ral dang / sgog gcig ma dang / dha du ras sbyar la bya'o //
translated: If there is precious poison, use iron filings, the three fruits, Re-ral, sGog gcig ma, and dhu-du-ra.

original: 'di ni sbyor ba'i dug gso ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyor ba'i dug gso ba'o //

analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo 'di ni 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs pa /

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams kyang de bzhin no //

original: kun gzhi rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par dag pa'o //
